meanings.definition: Face to face with (someone) in hostility or defiance.
meanings.sent1: She stood confronted by her rival on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The two cats confronted each other, ready to fight.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was confronted by a grumpy goose in the park.
meanings.sent4: The student felt like a tiny mouse confronted by a roaring lion.
meanings.sent5: The knight bravely confronted the dragon in the dark cave.

meanings.definition: Deal with (a problem or difficult situation) directly.
meanings.sent1: He confronted his fear of heights by climbing a ladder.
meanings.sent2: The team confronted the challenges of the new project head-on.
meanings.sent3: The chef confronted the burnt dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: She confronted the mountain of laundry with determination.
meanings.sent5: The detective confronted the mystery with a keen eye for detail.
